title.narrative: INCLUSIVE SECONDARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: 2.1. Adolescents, specially those in disadvantaged situations, access inclusive secondary-school education models that improve their learning., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, education inequity gaps are reduced and children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from quality and inclusive education, which provides better opportunities for their development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.1. Adolescents, specially those in disadvantaged situations, access inclusive secondary-school education models that improvetheir learning.

description.narrative: Since 2016, UNICEF has contributed to accelerate results to guarantee access and provision of quality secondary education. CO advocated for access and learning outcomes, particularly in rural and vulnerable urban contexts. ACO developed innovative programs to design and deliver quality teacher and management teams training to improve learning outcomes, digital and transferable skills, reaching morethan 218,000 adolescents.ACO supported evidence generation on policy implementation, adolescent’s learning continuity and equity gaps to foster secondary transformation.Finally,UNICEF succeed to foster adolescents’ participation along the CPD and contribute to COVID19 National response plan to mitigate the school lockdown impact on adolescents. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/08/2021
